title: Social Media & Brand Engagement Officer Job at Abbfem Group
content:
Abbfem Group is a dynamic, multi-disciplinary company based in the United Kingdom, focused on delivering innovative solutions across technology, consultancy, and training. With a passion for empowering individuals and organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media & Brand Engagement Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a Social Media & Brand Engagement Officer to help grow our digital presence and expand our influence in real-world communities. If you can design flyers, edit videos, and create content that connects—we’d love to meet you!


Key Responsibilities


	Create and manage engaging, platform-specific content across Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, X (formerly Twitter), and Facebook
	Design eye-catching flyers and edit compelling short-form videos for campaigns
	Monitor trends and keep content fresh, relevant, and audience-focused
	Analyze metrics, report performance, and optimize strategy accordingly
	Support offline activations, community events, and outreach initiatives
	Engage actively with our community—responding to comments, messages, and creating connections
	Collaborate with internal teams to align content with broader marketing and business goals
	Bring bold ideas that elevate visibility, build brand loyalty, and drive engagement


Qualifications


	Passion for visual storytelling
	Have experience designing content (Canva, Adobe Suite, CapCut, etc.)
	Love being part of conversations and building meaningful communities


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candiates should send their Applications to: hr@abbfem.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Customer Service Representative Job at EshopAfrica Logistics
content:
EshopAfrica Logistics is a global logistics company with warehouses in the U.S., China, and Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative

Job Location: Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Establish and maintain effective communication with clients through meetings, calls, and follow-ups.
	Respond to customer inquiries promptly, providing accurate and comprehensive information about our services.
	Conduct inspections of items for defects and report issues as necessary.
	Keep detailed and organized records of all sales activities and customer interactions.
	Efficiently process, pack, and ship orders with accuracy.
	Prepare all required shipping documents, including bills of lading and customs paperwork, ensuring compliance and accuracy.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc Degree in any discipline.
	1-3 years of work experience.
	Strong customer service and relationship-building skills.
	Excellent verbal and communication skills.
	Proven customer support or experience as a customer service representative.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@myafrimall.com using the Job Position as the Subject of the mail.

title: Debt Collections Manager Job at Renmoney
content:
Renmoney - We are a passionate team determined to challenge the status quo and make financial inclusion count for the millions of under-banked individuals and small business owners in Nigeria. We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Debt Collections Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid).

Job Description
Strategy & Execution:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement efficient loan collection strategies tailored to a digital lending environment.
	Segment loan portfolios and prioritize collection actions based on risk exposure and customer behavior.
	Design and monitor automated workflows and digital touchpoints (e.g., SMS, email, app notifications) for collections.


Team Management:


	Supervise and coach collections officers and agents to meet collections targets.
	Monitor team performance and provide regular feedback and training.


Process Optimization:


	Leverage technology, including CRM tools, AI, and analytics platforms to track loan delinquencies and optimize collection efficiency.
	Collaborate with product, tech, and data teams to continuously refine collections processes.


Customer Engagement:


	Handle escalated customer issues with professionalism and tact.
	Develop user-friendly repayment plans and negotiate settlements where appropriate.


Reporting & Compliance:


	Maintain accurate records of interactions, payments, and commitments.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies.
	Provide regular reports and insights to management on portfolio performance, trends, and risks.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in collections or credit recovery, with at least 2 in a digital lending or fintech environment.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Proficient in the use of digital collection tools, CRMs, and Excel/data analytics platforms.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and customer service skills.
	Familiarity with local financial regulations and microfinance operations.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with loan management systems (LMS) and digital banking platforms.
	Certification in credit management or debt recovery.
	Excellent skills in Microsoft office


Benefits


	You’ll receive competitive compensation and work with amazing people. 
	You’ll work in a beautiful environment with a flat structure and solve complex, real-world challenges.

title: SME Underwriter Job at Renmoney
content:
Renmoney - We are a passionate team determined to challenge the status quo and make financial inclusion count for the millions of under-banked individuals and small business owners in Nigeria. We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: SME Underwriter
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Evaluate SME and corporate loan applications by analyzing financial statements, cash flow, business models, and creditworthiness.
	Identify and assess key risks (financial, industry, management, collateral) and recommend appropriate mitigants.
	Structure credit facilities in line with the borrower's needs and the bank’s risk appetite, including terms, pricing, and security requirements.
	Monitor assigned portfolio performance, ensure covenant compliance, and flag early warning signs or deterioration in credit quality.
	Ensure all credit evaluations and decisions adhere to internal policies, regulatory guidelines, and credit approval frameworks.
	Draft detailed credit proposals or memos with clear justifications, risk analysis, and recommendations for approval.
	Liaise with relationship managers, legal, and risk teams to coordinate customer due diligence, site visits, and validation of submitted documents.
	Assess adequacy and enforceability of collateral, and work with legal to ensure proper documentation and perfection.
	Collaborate with Relationship Managers, Credit Committee, and other internal stakeholders to drive timely and sound credit decisions


Requirements


	Proven experience in SME underwriting and credit risk assessment, with at least [3] years of experience in SME/Corporate credit analysis.
	Commercial banking experience as a credit analyst would be a plus.
	Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial statements, assess creditworthiness, and make data-driven lending decisions.
	In-depth knowledge of lending regulations, risk management principles, and best practices in underwriting.
	Excellent interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to articulate complex financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders.
	A strategic mindset with a keen focus on portfolio performance and risk management.


Benefits


	You’ll receive competitive compensation and work with amazing people.
	You’ll work in a beautiful environment with a flat structure and solve complex, real-world challenges.
